content.description: An experiment to measure the rate of respiration in crickets and mice at 10o C and 25o C was performed using a respirometer, an apparatus that measures changes in gas volume. Respiration was measured in mL of O2 consumed per gram of organism over several five-minute trials, and the following data were obtained.
content.question: According to the data, the mice at 10o C demonstrated greater oxygen consumption per gram of tissue than did the mice at 25o C. This is most likely explained by which of the following statements?

choices.label: The mice at 10o C had a higher rate of ATP production than the mice at 25o C.
The mice at 10o C had a lower metabolic rate than the mice at 25o C.
The mice at 25o C weighed less than the mice at 10o C.
The mice at 25o C were more active than the mice at 10o C.

content.answer: The mice at 10o C had a higher rate of ATP production than the mice at 25o C.

skill.text: 5.D: Use data to evaluate a hypothesis or prediction, including rejecting or failing to reject the null hypothesis.
